page.title: 05 HOUSING IN KIDSGROVE
page.content: Our area is varied, including rural, suburban and urban districts. The houses are also varied, ranging from 200 year old stone cottages to houses still under construction. The stone used to build the cottages was hewn from the nearby hillsides so that the cottages appear as part of the landscape. Many of the locals work in the mines and live in houses previously owned by the N.C.B. The houses have now been bought by the local council, or in some cases by the occupants, but the estate will be known for years to come as the "Miners' Estate". More and more privately owned houses are being built. Some of these are on estates where one house is very much like all the rest.Others are designed to the owners specification.Most of the houses have well-tended gardens.
